headline: Lebanon officer killed, two officers injured in afternoon shooting
author: Daniel Hamburg
sentences:
It’s peaceful, everything’s good and this was just like absurd I would have never expected this or even thought this in a million years that something like this was going to happen.”
A second joint press conference will be held on Friday morning with the Lebanon Police, Mayor Capello, and the District Attorney’s office to discuss their preliminary findings.

We’re all affected by this, and with the help of our families and every other law enforcement officer around this country, we’ll get through it.”
Neighbors were shaken by the events with some witnessing police in the area.
According to the Officer Down Memorial Page, this is the first Lebanon City police officer killed in the line of duty since 1903 and only the third line of duty death in the department’s history.
abc27 spoke with some of the neighbors who said it was alarming to see caution tape, lights, and so many police cars all just steps from their front doors in the middle of the afternoon.
LEBANON, Pa. (WHTM) – One Lebanon City police officer has been killed and two were injured in a shooting Thursday afternoon in Lebanon, according to Lebanon Mayor Sherry Capello.
“At this time we are focused on the tragic loss of the officer and the well-being of the other members of our police department,” said Mayor Capello.
One of the officers injured is in critical, but stable condition and the second is in stable condition at area hospitals.
Gunfire was exchanged at 4:24 p.m. and officials say the suspect, a 34-year-old white Lebanon man, is dead.
Police responded to the 1100 block of Forest Street in Lebanon around 3:36 p.m. for a domestic incident.
Police Chief Breiner says the Lebanon County District Attorney’s Office is handling the investigation.
Lebanon City Police Department Chief Todd Breiner said the man was shot and killed by police.
“Our guys are strong, but we’re human and we have families and people were injured today.

Thursday’s Press Conference
“It’s clearly a traumatic event,” said Chief Breiner.
The names of the three officers were not yet released Thursday night.
This neighborhood never gets attention, it’s usually really chill.
One neighbor expressed disbelief about what happened in the area.
